summary: This is a transcript of a grand jury proceeding in the Southern District of New York where an Assistant U.S. Attorney presents a proposed superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. The proceeding focuses on correcting two clerical errors (docket numbers) in the perjury counts of an indictment the grand jury had returned the previous week. No new evidence or witnesses are presented.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual charged in the six-count superseding indictment being presented to the grand jury. The charges include perjury related to her 2016 deposition testimony.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned by the prosecutor when asking grand jurors if they have prior knowledge about the case involving him or Maxwell.

connections.description: Implied connection as the case is referenced as involving both individuals, with Maxwell being charged in relation to activities connected to Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Presentation of Superseding Indictment
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney presents a proposed superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell to a grand jury, correcting two typographical errors in the docket numbers of perjury counts from an indictment returned the previous week.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave deposition testimony in a civil case (docket 15 Civ. 7433). This testimony is the basis for one of the perjury charges (Count Five) in the indictment.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave another deposition in the same civil case (docket 15 Civ. 7433). This testimony is the basis for a second perjury charge (Count Six) in the indictment.

keyFacts: The grand jury proceeding was to present a superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, correcting only clerical errors in docket numbers (15 Civ. 7433, not 7344) for two perjury counts.
The perjury charges stem from Maxwell's deposition testimony given on April 22, 2016, and July 22, 2016, in a civil case.
No new evidence or witnesses were presented; the grand jury was instructed to base its decision solely on evidence previously presented.
The prosecutor noted that virtually all grand jurors had heard or read about Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein, or others related to the case prior to the proceeding.
The transcript indicates an FBI Special Agent testified before the grand jury the previous week, though the agent is not named in this excerpt.
